page.shortlink: api client api a5 chart render data axis object

property.name: type
property.description: The axis type. Value will be "continuous" or "discrete".

property.name: as
property.description: The data type of the axis. Value can be "number", "date" or "string".

property.name: on
property.description: The name of the actual axis the "value" axis is being drawn on. Only applies to "linear" and "radial" charts.

property.name: base
property.description: The base value of the axis.

property.name: min
property.description: The max value of the axis.

property.name: max
property.description: The max value of the axis.

property.name: range
property.description: The range of the axis from min to max.

property.name: step
property.description: The interval step used on the axis.

property.name: direction
property.description: The direction the axis is being drawn. A value of "1" is normal and "-1" is reversed.

property.name: stack
property.description: The stacking of the axis if applicable.

property.name: offset
property.description: If the axis type is "discrete" and the value is true then the axis is being drawn with offset.

property.name: marks
property.description: The marks on the axis. each mark is defined as an array of values. The first value is the actual value on the axis. The second is the relative value (0 to 1). The third if the absolute value (e.g. relative multiplied by range). The fourth is the description of the mark as a string ("base", "min", "max" or "interval"). And the fifth (if included - such as with a polar angle axis) is the actual absolute value.
